intro: Hieracium tucumanicum var. tucumanicum, commonly known as Tucumán hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and its flowering stems are usually unbranched. This species is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
